intro: Melancranis bolusii, commonly known as the Bolus's melanthus, is a rare and unique plant species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its distinctive inflorescence. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a compact cluster. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
